title: Hardy Plants
marks: Signature and Inscription. LL in gray: [Klee]
provenance:
Galka Scheyer [1889-1945] by 1939. [1] Nierendorf Gallery,New York, New York. [2] J. B. Neumann [1887-1961], New York, New York, by 1943 to 1944. Clifford Odets, New York, New York by 1951. [3] (Paul Kantor Gallery, Beverly Hills, California, by 1959); [4] Donald and Elizabeth Martin Winston, Los Angeles, California, 1959; gift to MIA in 1964.

[1] Discovery of loan label on panel verso reveals that this painting was lent to the San Francisco Museum of Art in October 1939 by the owner 'Galka Scheyer'.

[2] Partly torn label on the verso of the painting indicates that the work was with Nierendorf Gallery at one point. No date has been ascertained. 

[3] 1959 invoice in curatorial file giving provenance notes, "Clifford Odets: See ArtNews." An exhibition label on the verso of the painting from the Museum of Modern Art indicates that Odets loaned the work for a 1951 show. J. B. Neumann, who owned the painting prior to Odets, ran the New Art Circle gallery, and held several Klee exhibitions throughout the 1940s. As a note of interest, in 1948, Neumann held an exhibition of Odets' artworks.

[4] Invoice in curatorial file dated February 2, 1959 from Paul Kantor Gallery, sold to Mr. Donald Winston, Los Angeles, California.
creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Donald Winston
